questions.title: Question 2 for Class 190918
questions.main: The term storm surge refers to:
questions.answer: C) a rise in ocean level of several meters or more

mcq.option: A) the leading edge of a hurricane
B) a higher-than-average incidence of tropical storm occurrence
C) a rise in ocean level of several meters or more
D) the increasing speed of a hurricane as it moves in the middle latitudes

questions.title: Question 3 for Class 190918
questions.main: What is a tornado? Give some average statistics about tornado size winds and direction of movement.
questions.answer: The diameter of most tornadoes is between 100 and 600 meters (about 300 to 2000 feet) although some are just a few meters wide and others have diameters exceeding 1600 meters (1 mile). They tend to move from the southwest toward the northeast at speeds usually between 20 and 40 knots.

questions.title: Question 4 for Class 190918
questions.main: One micrometer is a unit of length equal to:
questions.answer: B) one millionth of a meter

mcq.option: B) one millionth of a meter
C) one tenth of a millimeter
D) one thousandth of a meter

questions.title: Question 6 for Class 190918
questions.main: Strong Santa Ana winds develop in Los Angeles during the fall when a ____ pressure center forms to the ____.
questions.answer: A) high, northeast of Los Angeles over the Great Basin

mcq.option: A) high, northeast of Los Angeles over the Great Basin
B) high, southwest of Los Angeles over the Pacific Ocean
C) low, northeast of Los Angeles over the Great Basin
D) low, southwest of Los Angeles over the Pacific Ocean

questions.title: Question 10 for Class 190918
questions.main: How does the thickness chart aid a forecaster in predicting whether falling precipitation will be in the form of rain or snow?
questions.answer: One forecasting rule is that the 5400-meter thickness line often represents the dividing line between rain and snow especially for cities receiving precipitation east of the Rocky Mountains. If precipitation is falling cities with a thickness greater than 5400 meters should be receiving rain whereas cities with a thickness less than 5400 meters should be receiving snow.
